result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Johnson, Travis H

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis H Johnson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Travis H Johnson in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

15CM217 - DRI

15CM369 - Guilty plea

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Raymond relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence
9 months jail - Huber granted - Credit for 14 days if revoked STAYED

1 year Probation
30 days jail - Sentence to begin Friday, 8/28/15, by 4:00 PM - Work release privileges granted
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment
Must participate in support groups
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Court costs - Cash bond in 15CM217 is to be applied by stipulation of the parties

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

(clerked by WH)
Defendant Travis H Johnson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Travis H Johnson in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM369 & 15CM217.


RESET TO WEDNESDAY @ 2PM.


FAX JAIL  Plea hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must have no contact with Stephanie G. or her residence.
Cash Bond must be posted by 4:30 p.m. Thursday, June 11, 2015.

ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

07/20/2015 THIS BOND IS MODIFIED TO ELIMINATE THE PBT CONDITION.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Court orders bond be modified to eliminate  PBT condition.
